result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case letter from the State

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Shane A Clark in court.  Attorney Darrin S Crawford in court for Shane A Clark.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a motion hearing on a motion to suppress as requested by the defense. Witness M.S. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Cross exam by Atty Crawford. Witness is excused. Witness D.H. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Venue established. Witness identified the DE. Cross exam by Atty Crawford. Redirect by the State. Recross by Atty Crawford. Witness is excused. State gives closing argument. Atty Crawford gives argument. Court will issue a written decision next week. 

Court will set this case for trial when analyst dates are received from the State.
From the state
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Lack of reasonable suspicion to expand the stop, unlawful request for preliminary breath test, and unlawful arrest
from Atty Crawford to reschedule the August 26, 2022 status conference
State gave offer to Atty Crawford regarding this case. No updated address was provided by the defense as requested. Court sets status conference.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Br 17

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Darrin S Crawford.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Law Enforcement duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over;   Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued
